knimeNode.name: Hough Forest Learner
knimeNode.shortDescription: Learns a Hough forest used for object detection.

fullDescription.intro:
Learns a Hough forest as proposed in Class-Specific Hough Forests for Object Detection by Juergen Gall and Victor Lempitsky.
A Hough forest can be used for object detection in images and is a special kind of random forest using a generalized form of a Hough transform to give probabilistic votes for the location of the searched objects.

tab.name: Input
tab.option: Select the image column. Can be either 2D (grayscale) or 3D (color).

Select the label column. The size of the first two label dimensions must be the same as the size of the image. The value of the labels do not care, every labeled part of the image will be interpreted as positive class, every non-labeled as negative.

tab.name: Tree Options
tab.option: The size of sample used to train each tree. A sample contains training objects which are patches of the images with a corresponding label and offset. They will be randomly sampled from all available training objects for each tree.
The number of randomly generated split functions used to learn each split.
The maximum threshold used to generate split functions. Threshold will be uniformly distributed in the range of 0 and the selected value.
Learning of a tree will stop at the selected depth.
Learning of a tree will stop, if the sample is smaller or equal the selected size.

tab.name: Forest Options
tab.option: The number of trees to learn.
Select to use a seed and be able to reproduce the learning.

tab.name: Feature Selection

option.name: Convert from RGB to Lab color space, if possible

tab.option: If selected the input images will be converted to the Lab color space. Works only for 3D input images. If selected and the input are 2D images, nothing will be done.
Select to add the first derivative in x and y direction to the feature descriptor. Two feature channels will be added.

option.name: Use absolute value for first derivatives

tab.option: Select to use only absolute values for the first derivatives.
Select to add the second derivative in x and y direction to the feature descriptor. Two feature channels will be added.

option.name: Use absolute value for second derivatives

tab.option: Select to use only absolute values for the second derivatives.
Select to add a histogram of oriented gradients to the feature descriptor. For every bin a feature channel will be added.
Select the number of bins which is the number of feature channels which will be added to the feature descriptor.

option.name: Apply a min and max filter (doubles the features)

tab.option: A minimum and maximum filter will be applied to the whole feature descriptor. Note that this operation doubles the number of features.
Select to use only absolute values in all feature channels.

tab.name: Patch Extraction
tab.option: The width of the patches which will be extracted of the images.
The height of the patches which will be extracted of the images.
Defines the horizontal distance of the centers of two extracted neighbored patches. Number of patches in horizontal direction will be 1 + (image_width - patch_width) / stride_hor .
Defines the vertical distance of the centers of two extracted neighbored patches. Number of patches in vertical direction will be 1 + (image_height - patch_height) / stride_ver .

ports.inPort: Input table used for learning. The table must contain an image column and label column which have the same size in the first two dimensions.
